messages.message:
Hello aihub users.
Earlier this month we released a new extraction pipeline in build which was gated behind the `enable_map_reduce_extraction`  flag. We want to make this the default extraction pipeline but we need to know if you have tested and if you are satisfied with the results.

Please respond to this thread if you have used and if it was it good or if you found problems :slightly_smiling_face:
I saw this but didn’t know what it did. What does it do?

basically it is our new extraction method that works for any size documents (up to 20 pages) to provide consistency in our results. The current extraction method uses the long doc pipeline if the document is big and this leads to different results base on the document size (and long doc replies tend to be more chatty)
Cool I’ll give it a try. Is the idea the 20 page limit will increase with future updates?

It will be expensive and we have seen that the documents with more than 20 pages tend to be wordy law documents (e.g. lease agreements) where it may be better to use long doc for (1) speed (2) probably better results.

If the usecase arise though that extraction may be useful for such documents we will revisit it
@Lee let me know what's a better way to communicate these internal features, because I think most people missed this post :smile:

We want to get feedback! so maybe a more dedicated place to highlight the internal features each release would help propagate that info better? Maybe we can have a short release overview meeting every 2 weeks?

cc @Bastiane @melissa.amos maybe we can have a Internal Preview internal doc for each release as well, and put the announcements / caveats there? so there's a single place for people to look for upcoming featues?
